value: /* Stata Replication Commands for: "No Need to Watch: How the Effects of Partisan Media Can Spread Via Inter-Personal Discussions" */

/* This File: November 2016 */

/* Read in the data */

** Materials to Replicate Table 3 (Main Analysis)            **
** Tables 1 & 2 are text-only, and created in Microsoft Word **
/* First, create a variable that indicates whether you watched video & deliberated  */
/* You need this for column 2: want to remove those who both deliberated & watched video */
/* This lets us actually test for two-stage effects */
/* column 1: does media exposure alone polarize? */
/* test for differences across types of media exposure */

/* just look at control subjects */
/* column 2: do two-step effects occur? */
/* effects of homog delib bigger than direct video exposure? */
/* effect of video larger than heterog delib? */
/* effect of homog delib larger than heterog delib? */
/* Beliefs about deliberation group participants (reported in-line) */
/* column: 3 effects of both deliberation and exposure */
#1.homog_delib = 0 /* does homog delib + video polarize more than video? */
#1.heterog_delib = 0 /* does heterog delib + video moderate relative to video alone? */
#1.homog_delib = 0 /* diff between discussion only and media + discussion? */
#1.heterog_delib = 0
